title: Jack Dunnett, solicitor, MP and property developer who served as president of the Football League during turbulent times for the game – obituary
text:
Jack Dunnett, who has died aged 97, managed simultaneously to be a Mayfair solicitor, property developer, Labour MP and chairman of (successively) Brentford and Notts County football clubs; he was president of the Football League as the strains with the big clubs who would form the Premier League became irreconcilable.

Dunnett helped to get English clubs back into Europe after the Heysel catastrophe and pressed Margaret Thatcher to scrap her plan for fans to carry identity cards, which was dropped soon after his resignation as League president in 1989. To Brentford supporters he was the chairman who tried to engineer a takeover by QPR, and to Notts County’s the one who drove, and helped finance,...
